12131212.title: Lucario

121312121.content:
Your name is Amy Valhorn, a lucario in a small peaceful town outside of a forest called Eastwood. Today is your 13th birthday...well actually that was 2 days ago and you came down with a sickness which you spent several days in your room bed-ridden, but today is the day you get to have your first humon. This is how your journey begins...

You were sleeping on the bed when the alarm blared out very loud which made you jump out of your bed and faceplant onto the ground.
"I hate it when I do that...oh wait this is the day I get my first humon! Finally!" You immediately stood back up, left the room, and slid down the stairs to see your mother making something in the kitchen "Hi mom!"
"Oh hi Amy, I see you are up and running again, even when you just got out of bed after 2 days you still have energy to spare"
"Sorry mom, but I have to skip breakfast, today I am getting my first humon!"
"You know you can't get out-" Before she even finish you ran out the door "Why do I even bother?"

Outside it was sunny as it can be, there were peo-I mean pokemon wandering around doing whatever and the labratory was a short distance away. You ran across town greeting pokemon whom which you knew and arrived at the lab, a one floor building with multiple sounds coming from it, You were about to enter when-
"Hey Amy, don't you dare get your humon without us!" A male said, you looked behind you to see two of your childhood friends. Rose a Roselia (Completely original) and Stanton a staravia. Both which approached you while tired
"You don't slow down don't you?" Rose questioned
"You guys actually waited until I got better?" You questioned
"Of course, it wouldn't be fair for the birthday girl to get last dibs now would it?" Stanton said
"Alright, lets go in" Rose said and all three of you entered the lab where assorted pokemon were working on experiments and computers. The Professor Sarcode himself was at the front next to a computer and capsule. The professor was a intimidating Abomasnow, which everyone says he's friendly, but I am still scared of him a little.
"Ah yes, you three, I was wondering when you would get your humons" The professor said and all of us approached the capsule to see it open revealing 3 huballs (Basically like pokeballs, but for humans or humons)
"Now here is the humons who will be your partners" Sarcode picked up the huballs and released all three.

The first was a slim and tall humon that was in dusty clothing, dusty hat, and had a worn out magnum by his side, the second was a female and she had on leather armor with a rusty blade on her back, and the third was a male with a gasmask, some black clothing, and he had some bottles on him.

"The loner, bladesman, and grendel. Three basic humon types that will be your partners" Sarcode said
"Uh, Professor these three humons seem unbalanced" Stanton said
"How so?" Sarcode questioned
"Well the loner has a gun while the other two have some crap weapons"
"You know that humons don't die easily just like that right?"
"Oh yeah, I forgot"
"Before you make a decision. The loner is a fast fighter with low defence, the bladesman has a higher defence and attack ratio, but she is slow, and the Grendel has a area of effect attack."
"Okay birthday girl, you pick first" Rose said as you decide on who to pick...
121312121.title: A Journey Anew

1213121212.content:
"You know Amy you are taking a long time for this" Stanton said
"Quiet, I am thinking out my decision" You reply
"Well then think faster"

13.content:
And of course I forget the organization of the Bestiary...

Nature: The elements of nature. Earth, water, fire, and air.

Moral: The element of morals and paths. Dark and light

Spiritual: The element of the soul and mind. Aether and Fig

Material: The element of matter and energy. Physical and Thauma

Godly: The element of deities. Deific. Oh don't even think about it

This page is for humon types that come into my mind at the latest. Note that the elements listed are their more commonly found element among their class. *indicates that it’s rare or legendary. What they resemble is somewhat self-explanatory sometimes
13.title: Bestiary

131.content:
* indicates rare or legendary.

Sniper: The long-range combatant
Weapon: Sniper rifle
Description: One of the most basic yet efficient long-range fighters

Overwatcher: The “marked for death” sniper
Weapon: Sniper rifle
Description: An elite version of a sniper, with more skill, better equipment, and looks intimidating

Blade runner: The quick blade specialist
Weapon: Light-blades (Simple daggers, swords, etc. Nothing heavy like a battle-axe)
Description: A highly agile and mobile sword-user

Double-blader: The quick blade twirler
Weapon: double sword
Description: A basic fast rapid fighter that is deadly against single enemies.

Whirler: The refined, elegant blade twirler
Weapon: Double-sword
Description: A refined double-blader who has more mobility and form to their attacks.

Archidon : The basic archer
Weapon: Bow and arrow
Description: A basic type of archer that is well-versed in a wide-variety of long-ranged attacks

Allbowtross: The flying archer
Weapon: Crossbow
Description: A type of archer that can fly with home-made wings

Sky guardian Aero: *Guardian of the skies
Weapon: One-handed blades and bows
Description: Guardian of the sky, greatest strength is speed

Loner: The desert wanderer
Weapon: Guns
Description: The agile western wanderer that tends to carry many weapons under their dusty clothing

Bio-loner: The deadly desert assailant
Weapon: A specified gun class
Description: The advanced form of the loner. The difference is that the bio-loner wears a bio-tech over their eyes and their armor rating increases. Though they lose some speed and variety, they gain skill at specific weapons based on their bio-tech.

Wanderer: The lone wolf
Weapon: Mixed-weapons (Magnum-swords, shotgun-swords, axe-flamthrowers, etc)
Description: From the bio-loner, the wanderer's will destroy any who attack them first which is a clear indication to not provoke them. With a hightened skill in melee and ranged weapons, they will be feared.
131.title: Air page

1311.content:
Blades man: The basic blade user
Weapon: Swords
Description: Multi-purpose blade user that can be used for several types of fighting jobs.

Blade veteran: Advanced blade user
Weapon: Swords
Description: Advanced, more skilled, and wiser than a bladesman

Blade master: The master in the art of the sword
Weapon: Swords
Description: The final step of becoming one with the blade.

Spearton: The defensive fighter
Weapon: Spear and shield
Description: A fighter that is efficient in defensive and offensive battle techniques

Core Guardian Cinder: * Defender of internal fire
Weapon: Long sword
Description: Guardian of the core, greatest strength is attack

Agro: The docile humon
Weapon: None/unarmed
Description: The agro never attacks unless you attack it. Be warned, it can dodge most projectile attacks and is a veteran close-combat battler.

Crimson head: The aggressive humon
Weapon: Unarmed and melee
Description: The aggressive humon that will attack everything in sight no matter the odds

Swords wrath: The honorable sword user
Weapon: Two handed sword
Element: Fire
Description: A sword specialist that's well versed in the art of the sword with a balance between speed and strength.

Mauler: The explosive specialist
Weapon: Grenade launcher
Element: Fire
Description: The explosive specialist that will bring a bad day to groups of foes. For whatever reason they always wear armor with some sort of camo.

Pyro: The burning man
Weapon: Flamethrowers (And other fire-related equipment)
Description: Gasmask, fire-resistant suit, and a flamethrower. This is the bane of everyones existence.

132.title: Moral

14.content:
The move book for all types of Humons. Some moves from Pokémon and Digimon, others not really. * indicates SPECIFIC requirement to usage.

Standard attack: A regular attack of a humon. This attack's power differs from the type of weapon a humon, from a stab, throw, shoot, burn, bludgeon, or punch to the face.

Unarmed attacks:Attacks made by humons with no weapons

Disarm: Takes away a humons weapon, reducing attack damage.

Cripple: Breaks an opponent’s limb, reducing attack or speed.

elemental punch: Elemental punches that have different effects.

Pressure point: attack an opponent’s weak-point, causing numbing and low damage.

Close-combat: A series of attacks that severely damages an opponent, though the drawback is that it slows you down from fatigue.

Full-body slam: User slam’s their entire body onto opponent. Damage based on weight

Morbid Fondle: A deathly undead touch which inflicts dark damage, lowers vitality, and sometimes causes Blindness


Melee weapons: Humons with melee weapons

Power Attack: A strong melee attack that does 50% more damage, but the chance of hitting is lower.

Whirlwind blade: A close range Omni-air attack where the user spins rapidly with blades, causing medium damage. After effect is confusion. *Two-blades

Behead enemy: A high-level, high damage attack where the user teleports behind an opponent and slits their throat. *High agility

Sin-strike: An dark attack that's power changes the more opponents defeated by the user

GET OVER HERE!: Bring the opponent closer to you, deals low damage, but they are open for attacks. *chain weapon

Rising sun: Jump high into the air and strike down on the opponent. High damage and accuracy is based on agility of both you and the opponent.

Fancy Furry: With each exclusive consecutive strike, damage is added on. effect is cancelled when an attack fails to hit or it transfers to another opponent.

Crescendo Slash: An attack that increases in power when used in succession in a battle. The first attack does 100% damage, then next does 125%, then 150%, 175%, etc.

Coup de Grace: Damage increases based on the number of status effects on the target.

Barrier break: A dark move that breaks the p.shield status

Spirit blade: An aether attack that depends on the soul instead of strength. For those with high defense, but low m.defense

Sunder: A strong earth attack that causes poison

Blood drain: A dark attack that drains an opponents blood and turns it into your own energy

Poison sting: A low-damage earth attack that can poison an opponent *Daggers

Puncture wound: A medium-damage physical attack that causes bleeding


Projectile attacks: Humons with projectile weapons (Guns, arrows, etc)

*elemental* attack: Load in a special type of bullet or arrow and fire, chance of status effect.

Penetration: Shoot through several opponents at once or to pierce heavy armor.

Precision shot: A shot guaranteed to hit a target, plus critical, but it needs to charge up.

Arrow rain: Fire an arrow and it rains down many arrows at once.



Special attacks: Attacks of Humons with special weapons (Explosive, throwing, and other weapons)

Martyrdom: Blow yourself up. Deals massive damage to opponent, but you die

Glass in your face: Smash a glass object in an opponent’s face. Deals low damage, but it causes blindness and bleeding *Glass objects

Incineration: High damage fire attack that attacks all *Fire weapon

Nitroglycerin: High damage attack that freeze’s a single opponent *Ice weapon

Tri-throw: Throw 3 weapons instead of one. About 3 times as likely to hit something!

Hammer of Dawn: A very heavy attack that kills on impact, but its very inaccurate, plus it needs time to charge. It’s not worth it! *A very big energy cannon

Addle gas: A gas that confuses opponents *Gas weapon

1000 needles: Attack with 1000 needles dealing 1000 damage...oh you better run! *Needler weapon

Acid: A earth attack that reduces defense and has a chance of numbing or poison. *Acid weapon



Magic: In reality all Humons can use some form of magic, it’s just some are better than others, or they know nothing at all


Fireball: Basic fire attack

Tremor: Basic earth attack

Bubble: Basic water attack

Thunderbolt: Basic air attack

Dark aura: Basic dark attack, can cause curse

Blinding light: Basic light attack, can cause blindness

Earthquake: High damage earth attack

Raging Inferno: High Damage fire attack

Tsunami: High damage water attack

Thunderstorm: High Damage air attack

Dark Maelstrom: High damage dark attack. Causes Curse and blindness

Solar Flare: Medium damage light attack that can blind opponents

Solar stasis: Paralyzes an opponent in radiant light
14.title: Move book

144.content:
This page is basically for Misc. things. Important or not, if you want to read it you can, but its not necessary

Status effects: Some of them are self-explanatory, but I’m doing this anyway.
Berserk: Uncontrollable rage. Double Str. and immune to numbness
Haste: Increased mobility.
P.Shield: Halves physical attacks damage
M.Shield: Halves Magical attacks damage
Regen: Restores 10% of hp

Poison: Deals damage equal to 5% of max. Health
Numb: Cannot use physical attacks
Paralysis: Randomly impairs movement
Burn: Decreases health gradually and causes str. decrease
Bleeding: Deals damage equal to 10% of max. Health
Blindness: Reduces of physical attacks by half
Confusion: Uncontrollable random attacks can attack self or allies. Wears off at the end of the battle or when hit by a physical attack.
Freeze: Completely unable to move for a certain amount of time.
Kill/faint: Humon when it reaches 0. It doesn’t actually die *unless you forget to feed it*
Curse: Disable all skills, both physical and magical
Silence: Disables magical skills
Sleep: Unable to act. Wears off at the end of the battle, when hit by a physical attack, or spontaneously.

There are also Elements in humons which determine their personality and sometimes their race, class, or whatever you want to call it. Something to know: If a humon has a different element than what its race is supposed to be, then they are kind of like the “shiny” of Pokémon, except they are not rare, just unique.

These are the elements of humons and what they represent-
Fire: The element of heat and fire. Those of fire tend to be passionate and easy to anger.
water: The element of fluids, including (But not limited to) water. Those of water tend to be intelligent or beautiful.
Air: The element of gases and their movements. Those of air tend to be random or chaotic in thinking and behavior. This also incorporates into electricity and gravity.
Earth: The element of solidity. Those of earth tend to be calm and wise.
Light: The element of light. Those of light tend to be selfless and just
Dark: The element of darkness. Those of dark tend to be selfish
Aether: The element of the soul and balance. Those of aether tend to be pure; they can take on many states. As in they can temporarily take form of the characteristics of another element.
Fig: The element of the mind and imagination. Those of fig tend to have unique abilities, from extreme imagination and creativity to psychic abilities
Physical: The element of matter. Those of physical tend to be defined as robotic or mechanical since its non-elemental.
Thauma: The element of energy. Which can be found anywhere and can be harnessed by special magical items. Those of thauma tend to be known as “energy beings” of the sort.
Deific: The element of deities, I do not need to say more.

This is the board of which elements are weak against each other.
Air > earth > water > fire > air
Light > dark > light
Aether > fig> aether
Thauma, physical, and deific have unspecified weaknesses, depending on their creation they have different weaknesses (If they have one)

Also if you didn't realize it earlier. Also condradicting elements and types.
Air= Speed. Equivalent to flying and electrical
Earth= Vitality. Equivalent to ground, rock, grass and poison
Water= Spirit (Spirit...you know for magic and all that stuff) Is equivalent to water and ice.
Fire=Strength. Equivalent to fire and fighting.
Aether is the equivalent to ghost types
Fig is the equivalent to psychic type
Dark is the equivalent to dark types
Light is the equivalent to holy types digimon wise since there isn't a holy type pokemon.
Physical is (To an extent) equivalent to normal types and steel types, but it is really machine types digimon wise.
Thauma and Deific...well go figure!
144.title: Known-how page

info.brief_description: If you played pokemon or Digimon, you know where this is going.
info.description:
Since the beginning of time, the humans have been with the pokemon and digimon, in which they worked together (Some in harmony and some...well evil purposes) Now enough with the long-story, this time instead of the humans being in charge of the digimon and pokemon, this time they are in charge of the humans which are now called hu-mons, also the pokemons and digimon are anthros. Also the same battle measures apply. Another good thing to know, Humons are used to battle for fun (And increase friendships) and sometimes help with some daily life things.

Rules:
1. No gay, no sex, no any of that stuff, no weird fetish, this is +13!
2. To make things diffrent, there can be cursing/swearing (Minor), no gore, but there can be bleeding of real blood or data (No bloodbath, but data bath acceptable)
3. Now here are some things to know, the humons need to be feed and nurtured (Meaning if you don't they die hating you). Also they can either be either be stored in pokeballs (Which are called Huballs) or some sort of capsule, data-disk thing.
4. Also, the humons can speak and there is a aging system in pokemon/digimon through evolution.
5. Though, they do have a leveling system, it also helps to have gear on your humon. Yes you can put gear on them to improve their battling capability. Also to balance things out, the humons can't just kill each other in one hit by hitting them in the head or heart, they have to wear down their health and those specific spots are critical hits. Other body parts cripple them.

Another note, for every type there should only be 1 character, this is to avoid a endless loop of characters no one will use

Enjoy a adventure and please add, its is going to be impossible to figure this one out by myself.

Also I forgot to mention: Pokemon and digimon can wear clothing, though they are completely optional it isn't required. And before you ask don't even mention the private parts ffs, most of them have fur or scales covering that. Humons are required to wear something to cover them, its not like they can retrack their own parts into their body.

Another thing I seem to forgot. The classes of humons are essentially going to be things like: Martial Artist, Samurai, Ninja, duelist's, Archer, hunter, swordsman, and many other variations that will come. So there, now you have the basis on random encounters or allies.
